verses.verse: Plea for Purity Finally then, brethren, we urge and exhort in the Lord Jesus (1 Cor. 15:58) that you should abound more and more, (Phil. 1:27; Col. 1:10) just as you received from us how you ought to walk and to please God;
for you know what commandments we gave you through the Lord Jesus.
For this is ((Rom. 12:2)) the will of God, (Eph. 5:27) your sanctification: ((1 Cor. 6:15-20; Col. 3:5)) that you should abstain from sexual immorality;
(Rom. 6:19) that each of you should know how to possess his own vessel in sanctification and honor,
(Col. 3:5) not in passion of lust, (Eph. 4:17, 18) like the Gentiles (1 Cor. 15:34) who do not know God;
that no one should take advantage of and defraud his brother in this matter, because the Lord (2 Thess. 1:8) is the avenger of all such, as we also forewarned you and testified.
For God did not call us to uncleanness, (Lev. 11:44; (Heb. 12:14); 1 Pet. 1:14-16) but in holiness.
(Luke 10:16) Therefore he who rejects this does not reject man, but God, (1 Cor. 2:10) who has also given us His Holy Spirit.

A Brotherly and Orderly Life But concerning brotherly love you have no need that I should write to you, for ((Jer. 31:33, 34); John 6:45; 15:12, 17; (1 John 2:27)) you yourselves are taught by God (Matt. 22:39) to love one another;
and indeed you do so toward all the brethren who are in all Macedonia. But we urge you, brethren, (1 Thess. 3:12) that you increase more and more;
that you also aspire to lead a quiet life, (2 Thess. 3:11; 1 Pet. 4:15) to mind your own business, and (Acts 20:35) to work with your own hands, as we commanded you,
(Rom. 13:13; Col. 4:5; (1 Pet. 2:12)) that you may walk properly toward those who are outside, and that you may lack nothing.
The Comfort of Christâ€™s Coming But I do not want you to be ignorant, brethren, concerning those who have fallen asleep, lest you sorrow (Lev. 19:28) as others ((Eph. 2:12)) who have no hope.
For (1 Cor. 15:13) if we believe that Jesus died and rose again, even so God will bring with Him (1 Cor. 15:20, 23) those who sleep in Jesus.

For this we say to you (1 Kin. 13:17; 20:35; 2 Cor. 12:1; Gal. 1:12) by the word of the Lord, that (1 Cor. 15:51, 52; 1 Thess. 5:10) we who are alive and remain until the coming of the Lord will by no means precede those who are asleep.

For ((Matt. 24:30, 31)) the Lord Himself will descend from heaven with a shout, with the voice of an archangel, and with ((1 Cor. 15:52)) the trumpet of God. ((1 Cor. 15:23); 2 Thess. 2:1; Rev. 14:13; 20:6) And the dead in Christ will rise first.

((1 Cor. 15:51-53); 1 Thess. 5:10) Then we who are alive and remain shall be caught up together with them (Dan. 7:13; Acts 1:9; Rev. 11:12) in the clouds to meet the Lord in the air. And thus (John 14:3; 17:24) we shall always be with the Lord.
(1 Thess. 5:11) Therefore comfort one another with these words.
